com.example.unlibrary.library

Class LibraryRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.unlibrary.library.LibraryRepository

  • public class LibraryRepository
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages all the database interaction for the Library ViewModel.

        listener - Callback to set the handoff location of the selected book

      • addAlgoliaIndex

        public void addAlgoliaIndex(Book book)
        Adds book to Algolia search index so it can be searched in ExchangeFragment. Book's id, title, and author are assumed to be non null.
        Parameters:
        book - new book to add to search index

      • addBookRequestersListener

        public void addBookRequestersListener(java.lang.String bookId,
                                      com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.util.List<User>> listener)
        Listens to requesters on given book.
        Parameters:
        bookId - Firestore assigned bookId
        listener - to give back the list of users actively requesting for the given book

      • addBookListener

        public void addBookListener(java.lang.String bookId,
                            com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Book> listener)
        Sets up a listener to callback to for whenever book details are updated (e.g. status)
        Parameters:
        bookId - Firestore assigned bookId (use Book::getId())
        listener - listener to call whenever book is updated

                             Book book,

                             com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailureListener)

      • declineRequester

        public void declineRequester(java.lang.String requestedUID,
                             java.lang.String bookRequestedID,
                             com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<? super java.lang.Void> onDeclineSuccess,
                             com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onDeclineFailure,
                             java.lang.Runnable onRequestNotFoundInDB)
        Make the required changes in FireBase to decline a request
        Parameters:
        requestedUID - User ID of requester who made the request
        bookRequestedID - Book ID of book that was requested
        onDeclineSuccess - code to call on successfully declining request
        onDeclineFailure - code to call on failure to decline request
        onRequestNotFoundInDB - code to call on failure of fetching requests necessary to potentially change status of book to ACCEPTED

      • acceptRequester

        public void acceptRequester(java.lang.String requestedUID,
                            java.lang.String bookRequestedID,
                            com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng handoffLocation,
                            com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener onSuccessListener,
                            com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailureListener)
        Accepts the selected requester, sets the handoff location, and clears the other requesters
        Parameters:
        requestedUID - accepted requester user ID
        bookRequestedID - book ID request is associated with
        handoffLocation - LatLng of handoff location
        onSuccessListener - code to call on success
        onFailureListener - code to call on failure

      • updateHandoffLocation

        bookRequestedID - book ID request is associated with
        handoffLocation - LatLng of handoff location
